ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Trial number
Trial type
Change Detection Task - Trial Response Time
Change Detection Task - Overall Median Response Time
Notes: Median response time, median time between a probe and participant's corresponding response across trials (ms)

ElementDescription: Change Detection Task - Memory Capacity Estimation
Notes: Estimate of a participant's working memory capacity in number of task items

ElementDescription: Change Detection Task - Attention Parameter
Notes: Estimate for each participant of the probability that their attention was engaged on any given trial

ElementDescription: Target stimulus number
Color of the (targetstimnum) target stimulus in the array
Notes: 1 = Red; 2 = Green; 3 = Blue; 4 = Yellow; 5 = White; 6 = Black

ElementDescription: X-coordinate of the (targetstimnum) target stimulus
Y-coordinate of the (targetstimnum) target stimulus
Color of the probe stimulus
Notes: 1 = Red; 2 = Green; 3 = Blue; 4 = Yellow; 5 = White; 6 = Black

ElementDescription: X-coordinate of the probe stimulus
Y-coordinate of the probe stimulus
Index of the experimental run in which the trial occurred.
Notes: 1 = First Run; 2 = Second Run; 3 = Third Run; 4 = Fourth Run; 5 = Fifth Run; 6 = Sixth Run; 7 = Seventh Run; 8 = Eighth Run

ElementDescription: Indicates whether the trial was recorded outside the stimulus window.
Raw time recorded for the subject's response; begins from 0 at the start of every run
Time at which the target stimuli were presented.
Time at which the probe stimulus was presented.
Indicates whether the probe was part of the original target stimuli set
Time difference between the presentation of the target and the probe.
Represents a response button for subject's response
Notes: 100 = Response to perceived non-target (left arrow); 200 = Response to perceived target (right arrow)

ElementDescription: Reaction Time
Indicates whether the subject's response was correct or not
